text: - [Instructor] In this lesson,
we'll use AWS Amplify Studio

to import designs from the
popular design tool, Figma,

and we can eventually convert
those to React components.
Go to UI Library within Studio,
then click Get Started.

From here, you'll see a
link to the Figma template.
This is a pre-created Figma file
with primitive UI components,
like buttons and inputs,
that are already pre-styled for you.
There is also a components page which has
prebuilt UI components.
You can build your own components here
or modify the ones already there.
For this video, I prebuilt a Figma file

remixed from the original
Amplify UI kit for you to use.

And this one has the
components that you'll need
for this notes application.
Click Duplicate in order to use this.

You'll be prompted to
create a Figma account
if you don't have one already,

but this whole project
falls under their free tier.

You'll see that the My Components
tab has notes built out

and different forms,
as well as the nav bar.
Copy the link to the Figma file

and then paste it into
the Figma file link.
Then click Continue.

You'll have to give access
to your Figma account.

Now you'll see your UI
components in Amplify Studio.
You can accept them all individually,
or altogether with "Accept All."

Now you can take these components
and export them to code.
We'll do a couple more things
within Studio and then do that ourselves.
